choices.answer: Atmospheric water vapor concentrations
Precipitation patterns
Runoff and stream flow
All answer choices are accurate

questions.question: What parts of the water cycle does climate change profoundly affect?

choices.answer: Increasing extreme precipitation everywhere
Increasing length of droughts everywhere
Increase in both wet and dry extremes
Climate change doesn't alter precipitation

questions.question: How is climate change altering precipitation in the U.S.?

choices.answer: Prevents soil erosion, and subsequently, a Dust Bowl event
Helps regulate water and carbon between land and atmosphere
Recharges groundwater, which is necessary for plants to grow
All answer choices are accurate

questions.question: Soil moisture is projected to decline with higher temperatures. This is an issue because it:

choices.answer: Decreases stress like a sauna which increases production
Decreases the livestock's hunger which reduces production
Increases stress which reduces production
Unaffected because livestock can regulate body temperature

questions.question: How will the projected increase in hot nights throughout the U.S. affect livestock?
How is animal agriculture one of the largest human contributors to greenhouse gas emissions?

choices.answer: Animals we eat produce methane through digestion
All answer choices are accurate
Deforestation for cattle farms & for crops to feed the cows
Nitrogen fertilizer for corn & soy grown for animal feed

choices.answer: Increase in storm surge
Increase in flash floods
Sea level rise
Plant growth

questions.question: What are the potential consequences of projected short but heavy rainfall events?
All of the following are reasons why the water demand is projected to increase except:

choices.answer: Increase in population
Intense droughts
Reduced groundwater availability
Increase number of personal swimming pools

questions.question: What can we do to combat the effects that climate change has on our water supply?
questions.resources: ZenShui/Frederic Cirou/PhotoAlto Agency RF Collections/Getty Images

choices.answer: Use the hose to wash car & clean driveway
Strategic water management plans
Take long, hot showers
Water agricultural farms in the middle of the day
Increased CO2 acts as fertilizer, but reduces crop nutrients
Increased temperature & drought cause loss of arable land
Flooding removes topsoil & drowns crops
Excessive heat promotes plant flowering

questions.question: All of the following are ways that climate change impacts agriculture except:
What will happen to crop production as temperatures increase over this century?

choices.answer: All crops will adapt to changing temperatures
All crops will die & production will decrease
Crop areas may shift to follow optimal temperature ranges
They use historical data & observations to create models
They use satellites to observe crop patterns & changes
They perform a blind taste test
They observe crops and gather data about them for studies

questions.question: All the of following are ways scientists study climate change effects on agriculture except:
All of the following are adaptive strategies to cope with climate change except:
questions.resources: Privately hosted; video courtesy of Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations: http://www.fao.org/home/en/

choices.answer: Deplete all soil nutrients so your plants are nutritious
Integrating livestock with crop production systems
Plant crops most suitable for local environmental conditions
Diversifying crop rotation to improve soil quality
